newsitem.title: USA: SFX Broadcasting buys concert promoter.
newsitem.headline: SFX Broadcasting buys concert promoter.

text.p: Delsener/Slater Enterprises Ltd. -- which has promoted concerts by the likes of the Rolling Stones, Paul McCartney and Elton John -- will be bought by SFX Broadcasting Inc., the multistate radio station owner announced Wednesday.
SFX, which announced an agreement to buy radio station owner Secret Communications' assets for $300 million Tuesday, did not disclose how much it was paying for Delsener/Slater.
Delsener/Slater will become an independent division of SFX and will retain its name, management and location, SFX said. Both companies are based in New York.
Ron Delsener and Mitch Slater will each hold the title of co-president and co-chief executive officer.

SFX Broadcasting Chairman Robert Sillerman said the acquisition would produce "great opportunities for promotional tie-ins" for the company's radio stations with live music events produced by Delsener/Slater.

The concert promoter, founded in 1966, has produced concerts by the Rolling Stones, Billy Joel, McCartney, John, the Eagles, Pink Floyd and Kiss around the Northeast, including New York City's Yankee Stadium and Shea Stadium. They also created popular "free concerts" in New York's Central Park as well as $1 summer concerts.

SFX owns, operates or provides content to 77 stations in 23 markets in Texas, California, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Rhode Island, Indiana, Connecticut, the Carolinas, Tennessee, Florida, Virginia, New York state, Kansas, Arizona, Massachusetts and Mississippi.
